Epaphrodites-Framework is an open-source PHP development environment that stands out due to its versatility and its ability to cater to the needs of web programming enthusiasts. Its uniqueness lies in its capability to execute Python code within the same environment, offering a rare linguistic flexibility. Moreover, it allows the simultaneous use of various types of databases (SQL and NoSQL) within a single project, providing unprecedented flexibility for developers.

Epaphrodites-Framework uses Composer to manage its dependencies. Therefore, you need to first install Composer on your machine. After you have installed composer, you may create a new Epaphrodites project via the Composer create-project command : 
composer create-project --prefer-dist epaphrodites/epaphrodites project-name
Now If MongoDB is not installed on your machine, we recommend removing the mongodb/mongodb line from your composer.json file. This will prevent errors during the framework installation. Or run this command : 
composer update create-project --prefer-dist --ignore-platform-req=ext-mongodb epaphrodites/epaphrodites your-project-name
Continue the installation by doing :
composer update
If mongodb is not installing :
composer update --ignore-platform-req=ext-mongodb
composer dump-autoload

To quickly generate a view, run the command heredia create:Front from the terminal or PowerShell. By default, all views for your application are stored in the bin/views/main directory when you use main or bin/views/admin directory when you use admin 
php heredia create:Front main test_new_view
Here is an example of a View generated from the previous command : 
{% extends layouts %}
{% from breadcrumb import breadcrumb_field %}
{% from message import alert_msg %}
{% from forms import input_field , loader , import_field , submit %}
{% from pagination import dataTable_pagination, pagination_field %}
{% block content %}

  <div class='container-fluid admin'>
    <h1>SUCCESS - VIEWS CREATED</h1>
    <hr>
    {{ __msg('site-title') }}
  </div>
  
{% endblock %%}

To quickly generate a new controller, run the command heredia create:Controller from the terminal or PowerShell. By default, all controllers for your application are stored in the bin/controllers/controllers directory: 
php heredia create:Controller testController

After generating the controller, you insert it into the controllers root : bin/controllers/controllerMap/controllerMap.php

<?php
namespace Epaphrodites\controllers\controllerMap;
trait controllerMap
{
   private function controllerMap(): array
   {
     return
     [
       'test' => [ new testController, 'SwitchControllers' , true ],
     ];
   }
}
}
